data.name: EPS Basics
data.text: EPS is a financial metric that represents the portion of a company's profit allocated to each outstanding share of common stock. It is an important indicator of a company's profitability and can be used to compare different companies.

questions.text: EPS is important, because it represents what?

answers.text: When the company has a net loss

data.name: Using EPS to Evaluate Stocks
data.text: EPS can be used to evaluate stocks and help investors make informed decisions. It is important to compare the EPS of different companies in the same industry and to look at trends over time. A company with a higher EPS is generally more profitable and can be a good investment opportunity.

questions.text: How can EPS be used to evaluate stocks?

answers.text: To compare companies in the same industry
To analyze the company's debt level

questions.text: What does a higher EPS generally indicate?
Why is it important to look at trends in EPS?

answers.text: To see if profitability improves or declines over time
